timeline.message: Test: Remove unnecessary reopening of stores

Test: Don't use openStore helpers just to open something else

There's a bunch of test code that calls openStore, and then converts
it to a builder, to change something and then re-open. Inline those,
in part to deal with the upcoming fix to #489, and in part because
it makes the code cleaner.
Also, one of the tests did not have a try around the contexts.
Cleanup a bunch of intelliJ warnings in test files

Resolves #903 Creating a bunch more fixtures

This probably isn't perfect, but better, I hope.
There were no code changes to any of the methods as part of this
change, just moving them between classes.
Cleanup a bunch of intelliJ warnings in test files
Cleanup a bunch of intelliJ warnings in test files

timeline.bodyText: This is maybe a different change, but I believe this is using uncheckedOpen in order to avoid conflicting on the store header create. I suspect we could make this a "real" open if we opened the store in a separate, initial transaction before all of this. Then the other operations would just read the store header rather than change it.
timeline.author: alecgrieser

timeline.bodyText: I guess this change here is logic preserving, but we could probably also achieve more or less the same check by asserting that the exception is of type FDBStoreTransactionConflictException (or whatever it's called) instead of FDBStoreRetriableException.
timeline.author: alecgrieser

timeline.bodyText: This kind of feels like it should be, like, an "index" test rather than a uniqueness test, in that it's really testing that behavior rather than the store's. But probably a rename that could happen later.
timeline.author: alecgrieser

timeline.message:
Use open instead of uncheckedOpen in conflict test

FDBRecordStoreTest.testSubspaceReadWriteConflict was calling
uncheckedOpen, but only to avoid conflicting on the store creation.
Creating the store in a separate transaction before is better.
Catch specific exception, rather than examining fdb error code
